tuv.seg: Disputes about equality and discrimination
Díospóidí maidir le comhionannas agus idirdhealú
The Workplace Relations Commission (WRC) now deals with all complaints of discrimination in employment and access to goods and services
Déileálann an Coimisiún um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre (WRC) anois le gach gearán a bhaineann le hidirdhealú san fhostaíocht agus i rochtain ar earraí agus seirbhísí
These complaints (formerly handled by the Equality Tribunal whose functions were transferred to the WRC on 1 October 2015) come under the following equality legislation:
Tagann na gearáin sin (arna láimhseáil ag an mBinse Comhionannais roimhe seo a aistríodh a chuid feidhmeanna chuig an WRC an 1 Deireadh Fómhair 2015) faoin reachtaíocht chomhionannais seo a leanas:

• The Employment Equality Acts 1998–2015, which outlaw discrimination at work including as regards: recruitment and promotion; equal pay; working conditions; training or experience; dismissal; and harassment, including sexual harassment

• Na hAchtanna um Chomhionannas Fostaíochta 1998–2015, a eisreachtaíonn idirdhealú ag an obair maidir le: earcaíocht agus ardú céime; pá comhionann; coinníollacha oibre; oiliúint agus taithí; dífhostú; agus ciapadh, lena n-áirítear gnéaschiapadh
You can find out more about this legislation in our document, Equality in the workplace
Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a fháil amach faoin reachtaíocht seo inár gcáipéis, Comhionannas san áit oibre

• The Equal Status Acts 2000–2015, which outlaw discrimination outside the workplace, in particular in the provision of goods and services; in selling, renting or leasing property (including the "housing assistance ground") and in certain aspects of education

• Na hAchtanna um Stádas Comhionann 2000–2015, a eisreachtaíonn idirdhealú lasmuigh den áit oibre, go háirithe maidir le soláthar earraí agus seirbhísí; maoin a dhíol, a chur ar cíos nó a léasú, lena n-áirítear an cúis le haghaidh cúnaimh tithíochta; agus i ngnéithe áirithe oideachais
There is information about employment equality and equal status, as well as a list of frequently asked questions, on workplacerelations.ie
Tá faisnéis maidir le comhionannas fostaíochta agus stádas comhionann, chomh maith le liosta ceisteanna coitianta, ar workplacerelations.ie
The Irish Human Rights and Equality Commission also provides information to the public on equality legislation
Cuireann Coimisiún na hÉireann um Chearta agus Chomhionannas an Duine faisnéis ar fáil chomh maith don phobal maidir le reachtaíocht comhionannais
Victimisation is also covered by equality legislation
Clúdaíonn reachtaíocht chomhionannais íospairt chomh maith
Victimisation occurs when a person is treated less favourably than another because they opposed discrimination or were involved in a complaint of unlawful discrimination

Tarlaíonn íospairt nuair nach gcaitear chomh fabhrach céanna le duine amháin agus a chaitear le duine eile toisc iad a bheith i gcoinne idirdhealú nó go raibh siad páirteach i ngearán maidir le hidirdhealú neamhdhleathach
The Workplace Relations Commission also deals with complaints of discrimination on the grounds of gender under the Pensions Acts 1990–2015 in relation to occupational benefit or pensions schemes
Déileálann an Coimisiún um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre le gearáin idirdhealaithe ar fhorais inscne faoi na hAchtanna Pinsean 1990-2015 i ndáil le sochar ceirde nó scéimeanna pinsean
However, it cannot deal with complaints about licensed premises and registered clubs
Ní féidir leis déileáil le gearáin maidir le háitribh cheadúnaithe agus cumainn chláraithe áfach
To pursue a complaint about a licensed premises or registered club you must take your case to the District Court
Chun coinneáil le gearán maidir le háitribh cheadúnaithe nó cumann cláraithe ní mór duit do chás a thabhairt chuig an gCúirt Dúiche
The 2 methods of handling equality or discrimination disputes are mediation and adjudication
Is iad an dá mhodh atá ann chun déileáil le díospóidí comhionannais nó idirdhealaithe ná idirghabháil agus breithniú
When you make your complaint under equality legislation, you may be offered mediation
Nuair a dhéanann tú gearán faoi reachtaíocht comhionannais, d’fhéadfaí go dtairgfí idirghabháil duit
It is a voluntary and confidential process
Is próiseas deonach agus rúnda é
Mediation is an attempt to get agreement between the parties
Is éard is idirghabháil ann ná iarracht teacht ar réiteach idir na páirtithe
At the end of mediation both sides sign an agreement which is legally binding so that both sides must keep to the terms of the decision
Ag deireadh na hidirghabhála síníonn an dá thaobh comhaontú atá ina cheangal dlí le go gcaithfidh an dá thaobh cloí le téarmaí an chinnidh
Mediation is held in private and the agreement is not published
Déantar idirghabháil go príobháideach agus ní fhoilsítear an comhaontú
If you do not reach an agreement through mediation you can request your case be brought to investigation
Mura dtagann tú ar chomhaontú trí hidirghabháil féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh go bhfiosrófar do chás
Mediation is held in private and the agreement is not published
Déantar idirghabháil go príobháideach agus ní fhoilsítear an comhaontú
If you do not reach an agreement through mediation, your case will be referred to an adjudication officer
Mura dtagann tú ar chomhaontú trí idirghabháil, déanfar do chás a tharchur chuig oifigeach breithnithe
You can read more about mediation on workplacerelations.ie
Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a léamh faoi idirghabháil ar workplacerelations.ie
If mediation is not used or is not successful, the complaint or dispute is referred to an adjudication officer who will conduct an inquiry and issue a legally binding decision

Mura n-úsáidtear idirghabháil nó mura n-éiríonn le hidirghabháil déantar an gearán nó díospóid a tharchur chuig oifigeach breithnithe a dhéanfaidh fiosrúchán agus a eiseoidh cinneadh atá ina cheangal dlí
Remedies will include one or more of the following: compensation, an order for equal pay or equal treatment, and/or an order that somebody take a specified action

Áireofar ar na leigheasanna ceann amháin nó níos mó den mhéid seo a leanas: cúiteamh, ordú maidir le pá comhionann nó caitheamh go cothrom le duine agus/nó ordú go ndéanfaidh duine éigin gníomh ar leith
Advice may be available from a trade union, support group, Citizens Information Centre or the Irish Human Rights and Equality Commission
D’fhéadfadh comhairle a bheith ar fáil ó cheardchumann, grúpa tacaíochta, Ionad Faisnéise do Shaoránaigh nó Coimisiún na hÉireann um Chearta agus Comhionannas an Duine
In general, complaints under the Employment Equality Acts 1998–2015 and complaints about discrimination in pensions must be brought within 6 months
Go ginearálta, ní mór gearáin faoi na hAchtanna um Chomhionannas Fostaíochta 1998–2015 agus gearáin faoi idirdhealú i bpinsin a thabhairt laistigh de 6 mhí
You should make your complaint using the online complaint form available on workplacerelations.ie
Ba chóir duit do ghearáin ag úsáid foirm ghearáin ar líne atá ar fáil ar workplacerelations.ie
The time limit can be extended by a further 6 months for "reasonable cause"
Is féidir an sprioc ama a shíneadh 6 mhí bhreise mar gheall ar "ghníomh réasúnach"
To make a complaint under the Equal Status Acts 2000–2015 you must first notify the person or organisation you are making the complaint against within 2 months of the last act of discrimination

Chun gearán a dhéanamh faoi na hAchtanna um Stádas Comhionann 2000–2015 ní mór duit i dtosach báire an duine nó an eagraíocht a bhfuil tú ag déanamh gearán ina leith a chur ar an eolas laistigh de 2 mhí den ghníomh deireanach idirdhealaithe
To do this you complete ES.1 form (pdf) and send it to the person or organisation you are making the complaint against
Chun sin a dhéanamh ní mór duit ES.1 form (pdf) a chomhlánú agus a sheoladh chuig an duine nó an eagraíocht a bhfuil tú ag déanamh gearán ina leith
The time limit for notification can be extended to 4 months by the Director General of the Workplace Relations Commission
Is féidir le hArd-Stiúrthóir an Choimisiúin um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre an sprioc ama a shíneadh go dtí 4 mhí

If you are not satisfied with the service provider's response, or if they have made no response within 1 month from the date you notified them, and you wish to pursue the complaint, you should use the online complaint form available on workplacerelations.ie

Mura bhfuil tú sásta le freagra an soláthróra seirbhíse, nó mura bhfuil aon fhreagra tugtha acu laistigh de 1 mí ón dáta a chur tú ar an eolas iad, agus má theastaíonn uait an gearán a leanúint ba chóir duit an fhoirm ghearáin ar líne atá ar fáil ar workplacerelations.ie a úsáid

All decisions of an adjudication officer can be appealed, to the Labour Court for employment and pensions cases and to the Circuit Court for equal status cases, within 42 days of the issue of the decision. Where to apply Workplace Relations Commission Information and Customer Service O'Brien Road Carlow R93 W7W2 Ireland Opening Hours: Mon. to Fri

Is féidir achomharc a dhéanamh ar gach cinneadh a dhéanann an t-oifigeach breithnithe, chuig an gCúirt Oibreachais maidir le cásanna fostaíochta agus pinsean agus chuig an gCúirt Chuarda maidir le cásanna stádais chomhionainn, laistigh de 42 lá ó eisiúint an chinnidh
